intro: Chaetogastra lhotskyana, commonly known as the Lhotsky's hair-plant, is a rare and unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate, almost ethereal appearance. Native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a plant of conservation interest.
